attributes.action: Ban use of supermarket trolleys to stop ease panic buying
attributes.additional_details: It will physically limit amount people can buy
attributes.background: To ban supermarkets from providing large trolleys to do shopping until current panic buying calms down

rejection.details:
This would be a decision for individual retailers, not the UK Government or Parliament. In any case, it could prevent people with disabilities, or frail and elderly people from being able to access groceries.

You may like to sign this petition on limiting purchases instead
: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300766

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
